Previous work has indicated that, historically, highly industrialized countries have contributed a larger per capita share of global carbon emissions than less developed countries, and in many cases continue to do so [ 54][ 55]. Likewise, a comparison of our constructed vulnerability index with per capita carbon emissions [ 56] finds a negative correlation (Pearson’s ρ = -0.60, R
2 = 0.300, p < 0.0001). LDCs occupy the upper range of the vulnerability index, while also having some of the lowest per capita carbon emissions ( Fig 3).
